page.title: 14History
page.content: HISTORIC BUILDINGS. Badmondisfield Hall is noted in the original Domesday Survey.The present building is 15th. Century but largely renovated.The moat still exits. Local photographs c1900 show children boating as part of the Sunday School treat. Gains Hall: originally belonged to the de Bures family at the time of Edward I as the Manor of Gaynes Hall Attilton (now Attleton Green).Has a wealth of exposed timbers, thatched, recently modernised. Inglenook fireplace. The Gesyns. Elegant C19th moated farm house. Boyden Hall. Grade II listed building.Windows of particular interest. 16th century construction. Village Primary School Victorian Board Sch (1878) retains many original features. Local brick. Suffolk House ex John de Lidgate's house. J de L local C14th poet. C14\15th features. Gr II
